title: Suvendu urges Bengalis not to visit J&K, draws sharp criticism from Trinamool Congress
content: The remarks by the BJP leader came after Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah called on West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee; the Trinamool Congress asked whether PM Modi, Amit Shah and EAM S Jaishankar endorse ‘such undemocratic, unconstitutional, anti-federal, and divisive remarks’

title: CPI(ML) warns of SIR rollout in West Bengal, flags disenfranchisement fears
content: Dipankar Bhattacharya says revision exercise may replicate Bihar model, urges public mobilisation against “surgical, invasive reconstruction” of electoral roll

title: PCB collects air samples from houses at Ayyankuzhi
content: A report will be submitted to the Collector based on the analysis result. Prima facie, the situation seems to have improved from the time of the fire notwithstanding a slight odour, say PCB sources

title: Three-day National Percussion Festival kicks off in Thrissur
content: Festival organised by Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Akdemi offers a grand celebration of rhythm, sound, and tradition under one roof

title: Axiom-4 Mission: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla makes most of his final days on orbit
content: The crew is pushing forward a wide range of experiments that could shape the future of space exploration and improve life on Earth, says Axiom Space

title: Voices of criticism against Tharoor in Congress grow shriller
content: Several Congress leaders feel angered that Tharoor has played into the BJP‘s hands by raking up the Emergency’s dark past when the country, what they feel, was facing an undeclared Emergency under Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Siddaramaiah’s assertions seen as posing a challenge to Congress high command
content: Knowing well that the OBC, Dalit, and Muslim vote bank is behind the Chief Minister, the high command is expected to buy more time, at least till the Bihar elections, to take a decision on the change of guard in the government as well as the KPCC

title: HC grants parole to man undergoing life term in murder case to get married
content: The court cannot neglect the brave stand of the girl who is ready to marry the convict, says the judge issuing the order on a petition filed by the convict’s mother

title: Catholic priest flays Tharoor, Deepika for article on Emergency
content: The editorial board of the daily took the decision to publish the article by  Tharoor. It has the autonomy to select and publish content as it deems appropriate, says Church spokesperson

title: Take government schemes to grassroot level, Krishna District Collector urges journalists
content: Highlighting the success stories in natural farming will encourage fellow farmers to embrace the practice, he says

title: Families at Ayyankuzhi refuse to move back to their houses, seek permanent solution to pollution
content: Nearly 30 families remain sandwiched on a 9.4-acre strip between two major public sector units— Hindustan Organic Chemicals Limited and Bharat Petroleum Limited-Kochi Refinery

title: Sharavathi project gets ‘in-principle nod’ from NBWL, but environmental concerns remain
content: The project has raised serious ecological concerns over its impact on the Sharavathi Valley Lion-tailed Macaque Sanctuary in the Western Ghats

title: In major revamp, BJP State unit appoints M.T. Ramesh and  Sobha Surendran general secretaries
content: Young leaders S. Suresh and Anoop Antony Joseph also appointed general secretaries. Leaders seen as close to former State president K. Surendran and former Union Minister V. Muraleedharan appear to have been sidelined

title: P4 is a grand step in social development, says Collector
content: The Collector adopts five families under the ‘Bangaru Kutumbalu’ concept, four families from the Shikari community residing in Nakkala colony of Tiruchanur and one from Daminedu

title: Catastrophic health costs: doctors need to be sensitised about financial consequences of medical recommendations, says journal
content: A Kerala Medical Journal analysis says, costly investigation and treatment protocols may contribute to financial ruin among vulnerable patients

title: CM assures BC leaders of ‘historic BC reservations’ issue overcoming all challenges
content: A delegation led by R. Krishnaiah thanked CM and suggested caveats be filed in High Court and Supreme Court

title: Lawyer seeks list of sacred names from CBFC to avoid using them in film
content: The lawyer has sought the list through an application filed by invoking the provisions of the Right to Information Act

title: Steps being taken to ensure proper distribution of quality foodgrains through FCI, says Joshi
content: The Union Minister for Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution has said that fake BPL cards will be identified and cancelled

title: 'Pick party first': Kerala Congress snubs Tharoor's 'CM ambition'; says praising PM 'not correct'
content: Tensions escalate between Shashi Tharoor and the Congress party as Kerala leaders criticise his CM aspirations ahead of the upcoming state polls. Tharoor's self-promotion, including sharing a survey favouring him, has sparked controversy within the party. Senior leaders emphasise the party's internal process for selecting a CM candidate, downplaying Tharoor's chances.

title: Tennis player Radhika Yadav murder: Mother mistook gunshots for pressure cooker blast
content: Former tennis player Radhika Yadav, 25, was fatally shot by her father, Deepak Yadav, at their residence. Deepak fired multiple rounds, with three hitting Radhika in the back while she was in the kitchen. Arrested shortly after, Deepak confessed to the crime, citing resentment over his daughter's income as a possible motive.

title: 3.7 magnitude earthquake hits Haryana's Jhajjar, tremors felt in Delhi-NCR
content: Delhi-NCR experienced earthquake tremors on Friday evening. The quake's magnitude was 3.7. Jhajjar, Haryana, was the epicenter. A similar quake struck the region the previous day. Earlier this year, Delhi-NCR felt tremors in February. Delhi falls under Seismic Zone IV. The region is vulnerable due to its proximity to active fault lines.

title: How KL Rahul's costly dropped catch of Smith cost India big
content: KL Rahul's dropped catch of Jamie Smith proved costly as Smith scored a vital 51, helping England recover from a precarious position to post 387. Jasprit Bumrah's fiery spell of 5/74, including a devastating seven-ball burst, was instrumental in India's fightback.

title: Top engineer quits Musk’s AI firm: Joins OpenAI; says ‘Jensen Huang was right, Elon & his teams…’
content: Uday Ruddarraju, xAI's head of infrastructure engineering, has resigned after a year, having been instrumental in building the Colossus supercomputer and training Grok 3. He expressed gratitude to Elon Musk and the xAI team for the experience. Shortly after his departure, Ruddarraju announced he is joining OpenAI, with OpenAI President Greg Brockman welcoming him and other engineers.

title: Microsoft layoffs 2025: What do job cuts reveal about careers in sales & engineering?
content: Microsoft's strategic layoffs, impacting over 15,000 employees, signal a shift towards AI-driven efficiency in sales and engineering. The company is prioritizing AI-native roles, replacing traditional sales approaches with AI-powered tools and requiring engineers to supervise automation. This recalibration emphasizes adaptability, cross-functional skills, and strategic thinking for professionals to remain relevant in the evolving tech landscape.

title: Rishabh Pant battles injury pain, shows grit with the bat in nets at Lord's
content: Rishabh Pant's resilience was on display at Lord's as he battled through a finger injury sustained on Day 1. Despite visible discomfort during net practice, Pant showed determination to bat, undergoing throwdowns and consulting with coaches. He even apologized to fans for not initially stopping for photos, later making amends with autographs and selfies.

title: Microsoft layoffs: Company cuts 15,000 jobs; tells employees to invest in ...
content: Microsoft is urging its remaining workforce to enhance their AI skills after significant layoffs impacting over 15,000 employees this year. The company is integrating AI usage into performance reviews and shifting its sales strategy towards technically proficient "solutions engineers." This move comes amidst substantial AI investments and a company-wide push for Copilot adoption.

title: 'Whole issue was ... ': What Radhika Yadav's father told police about her murder
content: Gurugram Police have refuted speculation surrounding the murder of national tennis player Radhika Yadav, clarifying that her father, Deepak Yadav, committed the crime due to disagreements over her running a tennis academy. Despite the family's financial stability from rental properties, Deepak objected to Radhika's work, leading to frequent arguments and ultimately, the fatal shooting at their residence.

title: Tesla India launch: After Mumbai, this city gets second Tesla store; and it's not Bengaluru
content: Tesla is aggressively entering the Indian market, opening its first showroom in Mumbai and planning a second in New Delhi by late July. This move comes as Tesla seeks growth amid slowing global sales. The Model Y SUVs, imported from China, will face high import duties, potentially increasing their retail price.

title: Suicide or murder? Woman professor found dead in MP home
content: In Jabalpur, Madhya Pradesh, Professor Pragya Agrawal, 55, was found dead at her residence with injuries, prompting a police investigation into unnatural death. Discovered by her domestic help, Agrawal was lying in a pool of blood with cuts on her wrist and neck.

title: Video: UP minister's 'Jai Shri Ram' reply to locals sharing electricity woes
content: Uttar Pradesh's energy minister, Arvind Kumar Sharma, faced criticism after responding to electricity complaints in Sultanpur with religious chants instead of direct answers. Locals reported receiving only three hours of power daily. Sharma later claimed on X that the district's power supply status had been shared and that efforts were underway to meet increased demand due to low rainfall.

title: Why Elon's Grok threatened a user with rape
content: Grok’s MechaHitler meltdown wasn’t AI gone rogue; it was mimicry unmasked – a chatbot parroting humanity’s darkest memes without understanding. Unlike Gemini’s woke hallucinations, Grok revealed our raw, unfiltered id. AI isn’t thinking. It’s reflecting us, shadows and all, demanding ethical guardrails before mirrors become monsters.

title: Gisele Bündchen: 'Death of my dream' confession — sparks healing journey — post-Tom Brady divorce
content: Gisele Bundchen spoke about her divorce from Tom Brady in March 2024. She described it as the death of her dream. Bundchen dismissed media claims that Brady's return to football caused the split. She expressed continued support for Brady's happiness and success. Bundchen is focusing on her own truth and has grown close to Joaquim Valente.

title: Canadiens eye $50M Cirelli — Lightning star could bolster top six — blockbuster in the works
content: The Montreal Canadiens are reportedly exploring a trade for Tampa Bay Lightning forward Anthony Cirelli. With a pressing need to reinforce their top-six, the Canadiens see the two-way center as a strong fit. As NHL trade talks pick up steam, Cirelli has emerged as one of the most intriguing names on Montreal’s radar.

title: 'No one will last with her': Astrologer predicts trouble for Swift-Kelce; breakup on cards?
content: Astrologer Mark Du Boise predicts potential heartbreak for Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, despite their public displays of affection. Du Boise cites conflicting astrological signs, suggesting Swift's inner tension and Kelce's hesitation could doom their relationship. While fans remain optimistic, the astrologer's claims have sparked debate, but the couple continues to showcase their bond.

title: When will TCS announce pay hikes? Chief HR officer shares update
content: TCS employees face further delays regarding salary hike decisions, as the company cites ongoing business uncertainties. The IT giant's attrition rate edged up to 13.8% in the June quarter, while workforce size increased. Despite a modest 6% rise in net profit, sales dipped by 3% in constant currency, impacting deal momentum due to US tariffs.

title: Shubman Gill argues with umpire, Broad highlights 'problem'
content: During the third Test at Lord's, India's repeated requests to change the Dukes ball due to shape issues became a major talking point, frustrating players and coaches alike. Despite the ball concerns, England mounted a fightback, led by Jamie Smith's counter-attacking fifty and Brydon Carse's resistance, while Jasprit Bumrah's fiery spell rattled England's middle order.

title: 'Absolute highways': Starc surprised by pitches, says he’d hate bowling to Gill
content: Mitchell Starc voiced his astonishment at the batting-friendly pitches in the India-England Test series, labeling them "absolute highways." He admitted he wouldn't want to bowl to a in-form Shubman Gill on such surfaces. Starc observed the conditions resembled the sub-continent, making it challenging for bowlers, while dismissing concerns about high scores in England.

title: 'Show me 1 photo': NSA Doval dares foreign media on Operation Sindoor
content: National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval criticised foreign media for allegedly misleading coverage of India's 'Operation Sindoor,' a counterterror military action against Pakistan. Doval highlighted the precision of the operation, which targeted nine terrorist hubs deep inside Pakistan and PoK, and challenged the Western media to show evidence of Indian damage.

title: 'Couldn't speak against Trump': Congress chief Kharge's jibe at PM Modi
content: Mallikarjun Kharge criticised PM Modi for allegedly failing to counter Donald Trump's claim of ending the India-Pakistan war. Modi, during his Canada visit, clarified to Trump that India wouldn't accept mediation with Pakistan. He also declined Trump's dinner invitation to attend a public program in Odisha, emphasising his commitment to the "land of Mahaprabhu."

title: Top entertainment news: Humaira Ali's brother claims her body, Parag Tyagi plants trees for Shefali
content: Showbiz is abuzz with Humaira Asghar Ali's death, her brother claiming her body amidst family estrangement rumors. Parag Tyagi honored his late wife, Shefali Jariwala, by planting trees. Priyanka Chopra shared romantic Miami vacation pictures with Nick Jonas and their daughter. Ajay Devgn addressed the controversy surrounding Diljit Dosanjh's casting of Hania Aamir in 'Sardaar Ji 3'.

title: DRS drama at Lord's! How Bumrah's sharp ears put him on a hattrick
content: Jasprit Bumrah's fiery spell on Day 2 of the third Test at Lord's rattled England's batting lineup, dismissing captain Ben Stokes and Joe Root. Bumrah's delivery sent Stokes back for 44, while Root fell after reaching his century, marking Bumrah's 11th dismissal of the former England captain in Tests. A successful review secured Woakes' wicket, further solidifying Bumrah's impact.

title: KL, not again! Siraj fumes after another KL Rahul drop
content: Tensions rose at Lord's as Joe Root reached his century, compounded by Mohammed Siraj's visible frustration after KL Rahul dropped a catch off Jamie Smith. This missed opportunity, coupled with Jadeja's earlier concerns about Rahul's attentiveness, added to the pressure. The series stands level at 1-1, intensifying the importance of each moment in the ongoing Test match.

title: Radhika Yadav murder: Music video featuring Gurgaon tennis coach surfaces
content: Radhika Yadav, a 25-year-old tennis coach, was allegedly murdered by her father at their Gurgaon home. A music video featuring Radhika in a lead role surfaced after the incident, prompting police to investigate if it contributed to the conflict. The father confessed, citing financial dependence on his daughter as a source of tension.

title: DOGE falling apart: Key Musk-aligned staff quit agency
content: The elite federal task force DOGE, created to overhaul the US government under Elon Musk, is losing influence as key officials and engineers depart following Musk's exit from day-to-day operations. Despite these departures, the White House asserts that DOGE's mission to improve government efficiency and eliminate waste continues, highlighting significant savings and ongoing projects like AI.gov.

title: Joe Root breaks Rahul Dravid's record, now among top 5 century scorers in Tests
content: Joe Root's magnificent form continues as he scores his 37th Test century against India at Lord's, reaching the milestone with a boundary off Jasprit Bumrah. This century marks Root's third consecutive ton at the Home of Cricket, placing him alongside legends Jack Hobbs and Michael Vaughan.

title: Slapgate row: Case registered against Sena MLA for slapping canteen worker
content: Mumbai police filed a case against Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad for allegedly slapping a canteen worker. He faced criticism for the incident and claims of serving stale food. The FDA suspended the canteen's license and collected food samples. Gaikwad further sparked controversy by accusing the Shetty community of damaging Maharashtra's culture through questionable businesses in Mumbai.

title: Who is Sofia Vergara? 53-year-old stuns at Bezos’ wedding; reports link her to Tom Brady
content: Tom Brady's appearance with Sofia Vergara at Jeff Bezos' wedding has sparked romance rumors, surprising fans after his years away from dating speculation. Vergara, a successful actress known for 'Modern Family,' recently divorced Joe Manganiello. Kim Kardashian and Sydney Sweeney are also reportedly in the mix, adding to the drama surrounding Brady's potential new relationship.

title: ‘Unnecessary barriers…’: US slams India on dairy certificates; raises issue amidst trade talks
content: Amidst ongoing discussions for an interim trade agreement, the US has again raised concerns at the WTO regarding India's dairy certificate requirements, deeming them unnecessary obstacles for American exports. India has also proposed retaliatory tariffs against the US on steel and aluminium.

title: Pakistan bus attack: Rebels check IDs, kill 9 passengers
content: In a tragic incident in Pakistan's Balochistan province, nine individuals were fatally shot by rebels after being abducted from passenger buses. The victims were identified based on their Punjab origins, as revealed by their identity cards. The Balochistan Liberation Front (BLA) claimed responsibility for the attack, highlighting the ongoing insurgency and targeting of non-Baloch civilians.

title: Air India crash: Report may explain what went wrong; peek into final moments expected
content: A preliminary report on the Air India 171 crash, which killed 241 onboard and over 30 on the ground, is expected soon. Investigators are focusing on the possibility of fuel control switch movement as a potential cause for the dual engine failure shortly after takeoff.

title: Inside India's skill divide: Top performing states; vocational trends
content: PARAKH Rashtriya Sarvekshan 2024 reveals uneven progress in vocational education. Gujarat leads in school offerings, but student enrollment lags in states like Bihar and Odisha. Delhi and Chandigarh show high student interest despite fewer resources. The report emphasizes the need for awareness and relevant courses. Bridging the gap between provision and participation is crucial for a skilled future.

title: ‘Paisa double’ trap: How Bengaluru woman used kitty parties as bait; 30 duped of Rs 5 crore
content: Savita G, a 49-year-old woman, and her accomplice, Puneet P, were arrested for allegedly defrauding her social circle of over Rs 5 crore. Savita lured women from affluent backgrounds with promises of high-return investments in gold imports and real estate. She gained their trust through kitty parties and false claims, ultimately running a chit-fund business.

title: Bihar SIR row: Rahul repeats ‘chunav chori’ charge; alleges fresh 'conspiracy' by EC
content: Rahul Gandhi alleges that the Election Commission is working for the BJP. He claims a conspiracy to steal the Bihar election, similar to Maharashtra. He questions the sudden increase in voters in Maharashtra. He says the Election Commission isn't providing voter lists. The Supreme Court upheld the Election Commission's voter roll revision in Bihar.

title: IND vs ENG 3rd Test: Pant spotted at Lord's on Day 2 - latest injury update
content: Rishabh Pant's injured index finger cast doubt on his participation in the ongoing Lord's Test against England. After being struck on Day 1, Pant's discomfort during batting drills on Day 2 suggests Dhruv Jurel will likely continue as wicketkeeper. Pant's injury occurred while attempting to stop a delivery, leading to treatment and observation by the medical team and coaches.

title: 'Son of Sardaar 2' trailer: Ajay Devgn returns with desi swagger, Mrunal Thakur joins fun
content: Get ready for a laughter riot! 'Son of Sardaar 2' trailer is finally here, promising a blend of action, comedy, and desi punchlines with a Scottish twist. Ajay Devgn returns as the energetic Jassi, joined by Mrunal Thakur as the new romantic lead. The sequel opens with the tagline: “He survived Punjab, will he survive Scotland too?”

title: Countering China: India eyes Rs 1,345 crore scheme on rare earth magnets; details
content: India is set to focus on domestic production of rare earth magnets with a Rs 1,345 crore investment, aiming to reduce reliance on China, which controls a huge chunk of global processing. This move follows China's export restrictions on these crucial materials.

title: IND vs ENG 3rd Test: Why are spectators wearing red at Lord's?
content: The #RedForRuth campaign, honouring Ruth Strauss, returns for its seventh year at Lord's during the England-India Test. Spectators are encouraged to wear red to support the Ruth Strauss Foundation's mission of aiding families facing terminal illness. The initiative has already significantly impacted bereavement support, with all proceeds from the day contributing to this vital cause.

title: Solar power could soon overtake hydel power in Kerala’s renewable energy mix, indicates KSEB
content: Hydropower accounts for 50% of the renewable energy bouquet, while solar power is now a close second at 47%. The latter includes both rooftop and non-rooftop (ground-mounted) solar power

title: It is only now a decisive step has been taken to repeal archaic colonial laws: Retired judge
content: Central University of Karnataka hosts seminar on new criminal laws under national legal reform campaign in Kalaburagi

title: CPI(M) stages protest demanding closure of Ariyamangalam dump yard in Tiruchi
content: The protesters have urged the State government to launch an investigation into why the bio-mining project had been stalled about a year ago at the dump yard

title: PBLP can be thought of after completion of Polavaram with 45.72 m FRL: Project Authority
content: The Polavaram Authority says canals of the project are being constructed with higher capacity than approved

title: Protest against lack of infrastructure at govt. school in Ballari district
content: Organised under the banner of AIDSO, the protest was staged in front of the Gram Panchayat office in Kolur village

title: More than aesthetics, percussion festival is a dialogue of struggle and change: Keli Ramachandran
content: The three-day National Percussion Festival, organised by the Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Akademi, began on Friday

title: SVNP-Tirumala route closed temporarily due to presence of wild elephants
content: Rajampet Sub-Collector says public safety is our top priority, hence devotees are requested to use alternative and safe routes to reach Tirumala; The unpredictable nature of the wild herd in case of food or water shortage makes the route dangerous to the pilgrims

title: Climate change poses mounting threat to India’s data centres, warns global report
content: Five Indian States among top 100 most climate-exposed regions; structural adaptations could avert billions in damages, says XDI

title: Ensure govt. uses open source software, says report
content: The report recommends greater state support for open source software by the government, and its use in education

title: Kerala University administrative crisis rages on as V-C rejects Registrar’s files
content: Left-backed Syndicate members urge the Vice-Chancellor to convene an urgent meeting of the body to resolve the existing impasse

title: PBLP needs revision of Polavaram project DPR as it changes scope: GRMB to CWC
content: The river board, in its observations on the new project, says there’s no apportionment of Godavari water allocated to erstwhile Andhra Pradesh to the successor States

title: Unbridled solar power injection into grid will have financial implications, KSEB tells public hearing
content: KSEB welcomes draft KSERC (Renewable Energy and Related Matters) Regulations, 2025. With day-time solar power injection to the grid crossing 1,000 MW, the KSEB says it is finding it tougher  to absorb this huge volume

title: Narrow Nochiam-Manachanallur Road proving inadequate for handling increasing traffic
content: Renowned for its rice mills, Manachanallur is situated on the outskirts of the city and farmlands have been converted to residential colonies on Nochiam-Manachanallur Road in recent years

title: U.P. 'has been pushed into jungle raj': Akhilesh Yadav slams BJP govt
content: Police are unrestrained, the Chief Minister is lost in self-admiration through his speeches and the administration is in deep slumber, alleges Samajwadi Party Akhilesh Yadav

title: Union Home Secretary Govind Mohan tenure extended till Aug 2026
content: The Sikkim cadre officer was appointed as the Home Secretary last year, and he assumed office on August 23, 2024. A Home Secretary’s tenure is typically for two years.

title: Automobile engineer to host first solo painting exhibition in Hubballi
content: Santosh Loni’s Noorondu Neerabanna will be organised at Kunchabrahma Dr. M.V. Minajagi Art Gallery from Sunday

title: Bag had clothes, not money: Maharashtra Minister Sanjay Shirsat after video goes viral
content: The video surfaced a day after reports emerged of the Minister facing scrutiny by the Income Tax Department for a significant increase in his declared assets from ₹3.3 crore in 2019 to ₹35 crore in 2024

title: Centre is punishing T.N. for its progress with unfair delimitation: Stalin
content: He accused the AIADMK and its general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami of standing with the Union government

title: Raptors F Ingram (ankle) 'pain-free,' says coach
content: Toronto Raptors forward Brandon Ingram is "pain-free" and in a "really great spot." according to coach Darko Rajakovic, as the versatile big man continues his recovery from an ankle injury dating back to last season.

title: Flagg makes 'winning plays' in uneven debut
content: Cooper Flagg made his professional debut Thursday night in the NBA summer league and celebrated an 87-85 win over Bronny James and the Lakers.

title: Agent: Bolts' Harris hurt eye in fireworks incident
content: Najee Harris suffered an eye injury in a July 4 fireworks incident, but his agent said the Chargers running back "is fully expected to be ready for the upcoming NFL season."

title: Hull 'feeling a lot better' after collapsing at Evian
content: Charley Hull is feeling "a lot better" after collapsing to the ground twice during the first round of the Evian Championship, leading to her withdrawal from the fourth women's major of the year.

title: LIV Golf applies again to get world ranking points
content: LIV Golf has applied again to be included in the Official World Golf Ranking, without any indication how it will operate differently from when its first application was rejected nearly two years ago.

title: Yanks, no-hit through 7, down 5-0, rally past M's
content: Anthony Volpe scored with an acrobatic slide on Aaron Judge's sacrifice fly in the 10th inning, and the Yankees rallied past Seattle after being no-hit for seven innings.

title: Fore! Barkley is longest shot in celeb golf tourney
content: Charles Barkley, who finished a career-best 58th last year, remains the biggest long shot to win this week's American Century Championship celebrity golf tournament.

title: Pelicans, Jones agree to 3-year, $68M extension
content: Pelicans forward Herb Jones has agreed to a three-year, $68 million contract extension with the franchise.

title: 📸 Dodgers unveil Kobe Bryant bobblehead
content: The first 40,000 ticketed fans for the Dodgers' matchup against the Blue Jays on Aug. 8 will receive the bobblehead.

title: MLB mock draft 3.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first two rounds
content: The MLB draft is Sunday! And this year, the drama starts with the Washington Nationals at the No. 1 pick.

title: Why LeBron and the Lakers are stuck in limbo
content: For months, publicly and privately, the Lakers have been signaling their desire to begin the Luka Doncic era in Los Angeles, even if it meant ending the LeBron James one.

title: The NBA is closing in on its first $1 million per game player
content: The reigning MVP will get close, but the league is still waiting for its first $82 million per year player.

title: How Jim Abbott changed the world
content: Abbott, who pitched in the majors with one hand, remains a beacon for families with unique struggles.

title: Why the NFLPA mess should matter to football fans
content: It behooves the competitive balance of the NFL to have strong ownership and strong labor, Wetzel writes.

title: Who are the NFL's best tight ends? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Execs, coaches, scouts and players from around the NFL ranked their top 10 tight ends in our annual summer series.

title: How do you decide between Skubal, Fried, deGrom and Crochet? All-Star manager Aaron Boone has his work cut out for him
content: The Yankees' skipper gets to pick the American League's starting pitcher for the All-Star Game. Here are the cases for each top pitcher.

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: We graded the offseason: Here's who crushed it and flubbed it, from the Rams (A) to the Saints (D)
content: We handed out offseason report cards to all 32 NFL teams, factoring in signings, extensions, trades, draft picks, hirings -- you name it.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Former heavyweight title contender Derrick Lewis is back
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? MMA analysts and former UFC fighters Anthony Smith and Din Thomas make their picks.

title: Heavy lift: Can Aspinall carry the UFC's heavyweight division with Jones retired?
content: Jon Jones is retired; Tom Aspinall is here to stay. Let's talk UFC heavyweights ahead of Saturday's Lewis vs. Teixeira main event.

title: WNBA awards tracker: Collier has company in MVP conversation; Bueckers takes over ROY race
content: Paige Bueckers has emerged as the top rookie, while MVP favorite Napheesa Collier has some competition.

title: Anisimova vs. Swiatek: Who will win the Wimbledon title?
content: It's down to Amanda Anisimova and Iga Swiatek -- each in their first Wimbledon final. Our experts pick who will win it all.

title: The perfect trade deadline addition for every MLB contender
content: A star outfielder to the NL West? A powerful slugger dealt to New York? We make moves for every World Series hopeful.

title: PLL Week 7 preview: Key stats, players for throwback weekend
content: The action heads to Chicago on Friday and Saturday. Here's the full schedule, key stats, injury notes, more.

title: Lamine Yamal's 18th birthday: Barcelona, Spain star's meteoric rise in 18 key moments
content: Happy birthday, Lamine Yamal! To celebrate the Barcelona and Spain phenom turning 18, here is the story of his extraordinary life and career so far.

title: Arsenal's "win now" approach to the transfer window could be a huge mistake
content: As Arsenal focus on winning now and throwing money at the summer transfer window, are they sabotaging their long-term Premier League hopes?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Lookman after Williams snub
content: Barcelona are interested in Atalanta winger Ademola Lookman. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Wenger doesn't 'share Klopp's view' of CWC
content: Arsene Wenger has dismissed Jurgen Klopp's criticism of FIFA's revamped 32-team Club World Cup, calling the tournament a "fantastic competition" and emphasising the support it has received from participating teams, players, and managers. Klopp, the...

title: Liverpool to commemorate Jota in Preston friendly
content: Liverpool's game against Preston North End will take place as planned on Sunday, Liverpool announced on Friday, in what will be the first match since Diogo Jota's death.

title: Source: Smith set for world-record Arsenal transfer
content: Olivia Smith is set to become the first player in the women's game to command a transfer fee of £1 million as Arsenal seek to secure her signature from Liverpool, a source has told ESPN.

title: USMNT's Vázquez tears ACL, blow to WC hopes
content: Austin forward Brandon Vázquez tore his right ACL, an injury that will hamper his chances of making the United States roster for next year's World Cup.

title: Bale: Dembélé clear favorite for Ballon d'Or
content: Gareth Bale believes Paris Saint-Germain star Ousmane Dembélé is the front runner for this season's Ballon D'or award "by some way."

title: Bale backs Alonso to make 'big changes' at Madrid
content: Former Real Madrid star Gareth Bale has backed new head coach Xabi Alonso to make "big changes" at the club, saying that he won't be afraid to drop anyone.

title: Source: Seattle's Fishel deal hits NWSL record
content: Seattle Reign FC has signed United States women's national team forward Mia Fishel on a transfer from Chelsea.

title: Tottenham complete Kudus signing from West Ham
content: Tottenham Hotspur have completed the signing of midfielder Mohammed Kudus from West Ham United, the clubs announced Thursday.

title: Is the United States too hot to handle the 2026 FIFA Men's World Cup?
content: The 2025 Club World Cup has been punctuated by a brutal heat wave in the U.S. that has left players and coaches flustered. The bigger question: What will such weather do for next summer's World Cup?

title: Colorado's reload, Arizona State's repeat bid, and the return of Utah and K-State
content: The Big 12 had a surprise champion and the Heisman Trophy winner in 2024. What happens in the league in 2025?

title: From adding talent to losing captains: NHL teams that changed the most this offseason
content: From the Sharks to the Stars, here are 12 teams most impacted by offseason moves -- for better and for worse.

title: Mother Sells Her Newborn For Rs 50,000 In Assam, 5 Arrested: Cops
content: A 22-year-old woman who recently gave birth to her newborn in Sivasagar Civil Hospital in Assam allegedly sold her infant for Rs 50,000. The mother was not married but became pregnant and gave birth to a child recently, according to official sources.

title: Earthquake Tremors Felt In Delhi, Second Time This Week
content: Tremors were felt in Delhi after an earthquake of magnitude 3.7 struck in Haryana's Jhajjar Friday evening.

title: Rahul Gandhi Pleads Not Guilty In Defamation Case Over Comments On Savarkar
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday pleaded not guilty in a Pune court in a defamation case pertaining to his comments on Hindutva ideologue V D Savarkar.

title: Karnataka Man Helps Bangladeshi Lover Cross Over Into Tripura, Arrested
content: A man from Karnataka has been arrested for helping a Bangladeshi woman, whom he loved, cross over into Tripura without any documentation.

title: Video: Rhino Destroys Vehicle, Charges At People In Wild Chase In Assam
content: A rhinoceros, who strayed away 150 kilometers away from Assam's Kaziranga National Park, was seen displaying aggressive behavior in the Demow village.

title: Adani Group To Restore Kolkata's Historic Kumartuli Ghat
content: In a step towards preserving Kolkata's cultural heritage, the Adani Group has joined hands with the Syama Prasad Mookerjee Port, Kolkata (SMPK), to rejuvenate the heritage Kumartuli Ghat, officials said on Friday.

title: Kyiv Drone Attack Kills 3 In Russia; Moscow Strikes Back, Hits Maternity Ward
content: Ukrainian drone and shelling attacks killed three people in Russia on Friday, while Russian bombardments on east Ukraine forced the evacuation of a maternity centre in Kharkiv and wounded nine.

title: Stock Markets Fall As Trump Ramps Up Trade War
content: Stock markets mostly retreated as US President Donald Trump ramped up his trade war, threatening a higher blanket tariff and a 35-percent levy on Canada.

title: $100 Million Crypto Tokens, Missing Footprint And The Trump Connection
content: A venture calling itself Aqua 1 Foundation and saying it is based in the United Arab Emirates announced in late June it had bought $100 million worth of World Liberty's crypto tokens, becoming the largest publicly known investor in the business.

title: Stunt For Reel Ends In Disaster: SUV Falls Into 300-Foot Ditch In Maharashtra, Driver Injured
content: He put the car in reverse, the camera was on, and it was time for action. He performed a stunt, and everyone watched. The man behind the wheel is not a stuntman, and the ending was not what he expected.

title: Raids In Jammu And Kashmir Over Alleged Terror Funding Through Cryptocurrency
content: Jammu and Kashmir State Investigation Agency or SIA conducted simultaneous search operations in Jammu, Doda and Handwara in connection with terror funding through cryptocurrency.

title: Imran Khan's Sons To Enter Political Spotlight As They Demand His Release
content: Ahead of the nationwide protest by Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) on August 5, former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan's sons, Sulaiman and Qasim, will lead a rally demanding their father's release.

title: "She Said Her Father Liked The Video": Singer In Radhika Yadav's Music Video
content: Independent artist Inaam, the co-actor and singer in the video featuring Radhika Yadav, told NDTV that the 25-year-old tennis player told him that her father liked the Karwaan video she appeared in.

title: Delhi Lt Governor Orders 'Strict Regulation' On Issuing Aadhaar Cards
content: Amid growing concerns over illegal migrants obtaining Aadhaar cards in Delhi, Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has directed the Chief Secretary to enforce strict regulations on issuing Aadhaar ID cards within two months, an official said.

title: Pak Court Suspends Order Seeking Ban On Imran Khan's YouTube Channel
content: Pakistani court on Friday suspended an order seeking to ban the YouTube channels of more than two dozen critics of the government including former Prime Minister Imran Khan, a defence lawyer said.

title: Delhi Woman Plots Husband's Phone Snatching To Delete Intimate Photos With Lover
content: A woman allegedly sought help from two men to get her husband's phone snatched in south Delhi's Sultanpur area to delete intimate photos with her lover stored on the device, an official said on Friday.

title: 800 Killed In Gaza Since May 27 Trying To Get Aid: UN
content: Nearly 800 people have died trying to access aid in Gaza since late May with most killed near the US- and Israel-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation's sites, the UN said Friday.

title: US Singer Chris Brown Pleads Not Guilty In UK Assault Case
content: American R&B singer Chris Brown pleaded not guilty in a UK court to further charges stemming from an alleged London nightclub brawl in 2023.

title: "Show Me 1 Photo": Ajit Doval's Dare To Foreign Media On Op Sindoor Claims
content: National Security Advisor Ajit Doval on Friday slammed foreign media for their reportage of Operation Sindoor, challenging them to give proof of damage to Indian infrastructure by Pakistani strikes.

title: Radhika Yadav's Father 'Simmered' For 3 Days After Argument, Then Shot Her
content: Details given by the police on the murder of tennis player Radhika Yadav have revealed that Deepak Yadav supported his daughter and invested Rs 2 crore so she could open an academy, and was also taunted by several people who called him a 'gira hua ba

title: Katie Taylor ready to complete Amanda Serrano trilogy at MSG
content: With her junior welterweight title on the line in a legendary rivalry, the champ reflects on a life in boxing.

title: Who is Red Bull's new boss, and can he keep Max?
content: In the wake of Red Bull's bombshell decision to sack Christian Horner this week, it was easy to miss the name of the man replacing him: Laurent Mekies.

title: Georgia to California: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 3 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our third "state check."
